title: 2.16 Meet the Neighbours: Pharisees, Sadducees, and Essenes
itunes:title: Meet the Neighbours: Pharisees, Sadducees, and Essenes
description: As the Tanakh tells it, the Jewish nation comprised a united body-politic from the fall of the kingdom of Israel right through the return. The only division in Judaism was between those who followed God’s laws, and those who strayed. From the time of the Seleucids on, the people fragmented into factions and religious renewal movements. Prime amongst these were the Pharisees, Sadducees, and Essenes: maybe.
content:encoded: As the Tanakh tells it, the Jewish nation comprised a united body-politic from the fall of the kingdom of Israel right through the return. The only division in Judaism was between those who followed God’s laws, and those who strayed. From the time of the Seleucids on, the people fragmented into factions and religious renewal movements. Prime amongst these were the Pharisees, Sadducees, and Essenes: maybe.
itunes:subtitle: Jewish society and factions in Jesus' time
itunes:author: Garry Stevens
